title: Unexpectedly compiles with nvhpc anyway despite ^package%gcc

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I ran
$ spack install hypre+int64+mixedint+mpi+openmp %nvhpc@20.11 ^perl%gcc@7.5.0 ^berkeley-db%gcc@7.5.0 ^ncurses%gcc@7.5.0
and 
got

==> Installing berkeley-db-18.1.40-xleecsov36kzqyiawtrsb4dhzmpqqzxh
==> No binary for berkeley-db-18.1.40-xleecsov36kzqyiawtrsb4dhzmpqqzxh found: installing from source
==> Error: UnsupportedMicroarchitecture: cannot produce optimized binary for micro-architecture 'zen2' with gcc@7.5.0 [supported compiler versions are 9.0:]

/home/cessenat/Softs/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:872, in _setup_pkg_and_run:
        869        tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        870
        871        # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    872        # show that, too.
        873        package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        874
        875        logfile = None
